message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.DS 

This paper is about learning Bayesian networks from a combination of user knowledge and statistical data, with a focus on domains containing continuous variables. The paper discusses the development of scoring metrics for such domains, which is a common topic in the machine learning subfield of probabilistic graphical models (PGMs). The most relevant arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is likely cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics such as PGMs, Bayesian networks, and statistical learning. Other relevant sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.IT (Information Theory), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), as these subfields also deal with topics related to learning from data and modeling complex systems.
